ovdesc.p: This application defines the soft conditions for discrepancies checking and default discrepancies at document checking stage(DC) in Drawings application.
ID should be valid LC type defined in LC.TYPES application (or) default record SYSTEM.

desc.p: Free text field to record the description of the disrepancy rule defined.
Specifies the discprepancy text to be defaulted when discrepancy conditions are met.
Associated multivalue field associated with fields DISCREPANCY.TXT to DR.DECIS.FLD

p.p: Mandatory when decision fields are defined

desc.p: Specifies the local routine to be attached to check discrepancies based on local conditions and return discrepancy text.
Associated multivalue field associated with fields DISCREPANCY.TXT to DR.DECIS.FLD

p.p: Decision fields not allowed when discrepancy routine is attached.

desc.p: Specifes the valid name from LETTER.OF.CREDIT application.
Associated subvalue field associated with multi-value fields DISCREPANCY.TXT to DR.DECIS.FLD

p.p: Accepts either valid field number or field name from LETTER.OF.CREDIT applications
Field properties for the comparison type should be same for LETTER.OF.CREDIT and DRAWINGS applications.
E.g CURRENCY field in LC must be checked against CURRENCY field in DRAWINGS
Not allowed when discprepancy routine is defined.

desc.p: Specifies the condition to be evaluated for the field defined in LC.DECIS.FIELD. Allowed values are EQ,NE,GT,LT,GE,LE,RG,NR
Associated subvalue field associated with multi-value fields DISCREPANCY.TXT to DR.DECIS.FLD

p.p: Mandatory when LC.DECIS.FLD or DR.DECIS.FLD are defined.

desc.p: Specifes the valid name from DRAWINGS application.
Associated subvalue field associated with multi-value fields DISCREPANCY.TXT to DR.DECIS.FLD

p.p: Accepts either valid field number or field name from DRAWINGS applications
Field properties for the comparison type should be same for LETTER.OF.CREDIT and DRAWINGS applications.
E.g CURRENCY field in LC must be checked against CURRENCY field in DRAWINGS.
Not allowed when discprepancy routine is defined.
